meanings.definition: To strip the blubber or skin from (a whale or seal)
meanings.sent1: The whalers carefully flenched the blubber from the whale.
meanings.sent2: She used a sharp knife to flench the skin from the seal.
meanings.sent3: The sailors joked that they could flench the blubber blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: The expert flenched the blubber with precision, like an artist sculpting marble.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the blubber being flenched echoed across the icy waters.

meanings.definition: To cut or strip off (the outer skin)
meanings.sent1: He needed to flench the damaged bark from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The chef carefully flenched the peel from the orange.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally flenched off more than just the outer skin of the fruit.
meanings.sent4: The sharp blade easily flenched the outer skin of the vegetable.
meanings.sent5: The old paint was flenched off the wall, revealing a vibrant color underneath.
